item.description:
At the Museum: Permanent and temporary exhibitions fill 25,000 square feet of gallery space.  You can imagine a trip along the paved roads of the Roman Empire, or the dirt back roads of New England in the early 20th century. Along the way, you might stop for a "bite" at the hot dog wagon, have a "drink" at the Art Deco bar, "down" cocktails on the First Class Deck of the Queen Mary, or you can even get in the kitchen of the Little Chef Diner and "whip up" a California burger and fries.

Admission: $7.00 with AAA discount $1.00 off

Directions: The  Museum at Johnson & Wales is located at 315 Harborside Boulevard on the Providence and Cranston city line. From RI Interstate 95, North or South, take Exit 18 and follow the signs for Allens Avenue. At the traffic light, turn right (south) onto Allens Avenue. Go straight for one mile. (The street name will change to Narragansett Boulevard.) Turn left at the traffic light after the Shell gas station onto Harborside Boulevard. The Museum is located in the first building down the hill on the left. There are designated parking spaces to the right of the museum's entrance. Guests are free to park elsewhere in the lot if space is available.

After we've worked up an appetite at the Museum, we'll head for lunch at a local cafe.

For additional information on the museum click here.
item.name: Culinary Arts Museum at Johnson & Wales & Lunch
